info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 16 at 2:21AM CDT until April 16 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CRAWFORD...SOUTH CENTRAL WASHINGTON...NORTHEASTERN SEQUOYAH AND SOUTHEASTERN ADAIR COUNTIES... At 221 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles northwest of Short, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations in or near the path include... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Chester... Lee Creek... Devils Den State Park... Blackburn... Odell... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 31 and 41. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
